description: *** Updated to reflect changes to the exam effective Jan 2016 *** The Project Management Professional (PMP) certification from the Project Management Institute is the leading certification for individuals working as a project manager. The certification combines breadth of knowledge with extensive pre-requisites to ensure that candidates who successfully complete the exam are competent and well versed in the various tools and techniques used by successful project managers. The certificate is targeted at individuals with over five years of experience working as a project manager and seeking to validate their knowledge and experience through becoming certified. Individuals without five years of documented experience should consider the Certified Associate of Project Management (CAPM) certification. At ITProTV, our project management show is designed to prepare the viewer for both exams.
descriptionMD: Updated to reflect changes to the exam effective Jan 2016. The Project Management Professional (PMP® ) certification from the Project Management Institute is the leading certification for individuals working as a project manager. The certification combines breadth of knowledge with extensive pre-requisites to ensure that candidates who successfully complete the exam are competent and well versed in the various tools and techniques used by successful project managers. The certificate is targeted at individuals with over five years of experience working as a project manager and seeking to validate their knowledge and experience through becoming certified. Individuals without five years of documented experience should consider the Certified Associate of Project Management (CAPM®) certification. At ITProTV, our project management show is designed to prepare the viewer for both exams. PMP® and CAPM® are registered trademarks of the Project Management Institute.
name: Project Management Professional
subtitle: Project Management Certification

episodes.description:
The Project Management Professional certification from the Project Management Institute is an advanced level certification that requires not only a written exam from the candidate but also verifiable non-overlapping field experience and continuing education.  It is the most significant industry recognized certification for Project Managers worldwide.  Project Managers with this certification are in high demand because it validates the excellence of knowledge, experience and ability in Project Management Leadership.

The following download link is to a Zip file containing the templates and formulas used in the episodes. 

https://itprotv-notes-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/ITProTV_PMP_Templates.zip
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don go over some of the details of the Project Management Professional Exam Update for January 2016.  They highlight the reasons for the change and show it differentiates from the current exam iteration.
episodes.title: 2016 Exam Update

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don introduce the viewer to the Project Management Institute (PMI) framework for managing projects. They take a look at the Project Management Body Knowledge and cover some required terminology for the exam.
episodes.title: Fundamentals

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don break down the five phases and ten knowledge groups of a project. They then introduce the viewer to project management processes and take a look at how to inputs, tool and techniques, and outputs are arranged according to the Project Management Institute.
episodes.title: Fundamentals Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don explain the layout of the PMBOK which is a resource available when joining PMI. They also begin explaining the initiating the project management process. Emphasis is given to describing the project management constraints, the Project Management Process--beginning to end, and briefly talk about Project Management Charter and the authority it gives to the project.
episodes.title: Initiation Phase

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a deeper look in how to develop a project management charter and identify the stakeholders. They show the breakdown on how to develop the project charter and how identify the stakeholders. They show some of the templates that can be used to help complete the initiation phase.
episodes.title: Initiation Phase Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don begin to tackle the most detailed phase of project management, the planning phase. They begin by talking about the purpose of developing a plan and why we need it. The project management plan is the result of developing how to manage the constraints of project time, project costs, project requirements and stakeholders.
episodes.title: Planning Part 1

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don introduce the knowledge area of Project Scope Planning. Understanding the scope of project must be measureable, attainable and manageable which can only happen if the scope is clearly defined during the planning phase.
episodes.title: Planning Project Scope

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don continue to plan the project scope and statement using the templates. They emphasize the need and parameters that make up the project scope. The scope statement will be used to help define the success of the project.
episodes.title: Planning Project Scope Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don continue to define the scope of determining the requirements of the project. These are the deliverables that we will expect at the end of the project. They talk about how to make sure you can determine these requirements.
episodes.title: Determining Requirements

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don begin to cover the largest topic within the planning phase--scheduling the project. They show some of the templates used and show some basic Project Management Scheduling Utilities that can be used to help with project time management. They talk about defining the activities, sequencing the events and assigning resources to activities.
episodes.title: Time Management Part 1

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don they show the process of estimating the duration of activities within a project. They use different project management software to show how the duration of activities affect the overall duration of the project as well. They show the most common methods of estimating durations and describe the critical path and demonstrate how to determine it.
episodes.title: Time Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take the outputs of the activities planning, duration estimates and resource assignments to develop a schedule to manage the project. They show how the project plan can be compressed and adjusted to fit the project scope.
episodes.title: Time Management Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look at the area of cost management for the project. They talk about some of the techniques used to create a budget for the project. They review all the relevant tools and techniques to estimate material and labor cost. They end the show with determining the budget for the project.
episodes.title: Cost Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don discuss how to handle quality management, resources and communications. They describe the how to manage quality control and quality assurance. They take a look into the subject area of planning for materials and labor management. Then Ronnie and Don talk about how to manage the communication paths and communication methods to be used during the project execution.
episodes.title: Quality, Resources & Comms

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don begin the process of Risk Management within Project Management. They use the concepts of risk tolerance: risk adverse, risk seekers and risk neutral as base for risk management of the project. They also talk about the tools and techniques used to identify risks. They describe performing qualitative and quantitative risk analysis before project execution begins. They finish the risk management planning by taking a look into the risk response planning.
episodes.title: Planning for Risks

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look at areas procurement management. They focus on contract execution, fulfillment and termination. They also show the most common contract types. Included in the episode are the concepts of stakeholder management and dealing with the motivations and agendas of stakeholders.
episodes.title: Procurements and Stakeholders

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don begin the next phase of project management. They talk about the transition into the monitoring and controlling while the project is being executed and work packages are being accomplished. They describe the need to direct and manage the project rather than micro managing every aspect of the project. They talk about using Project Management Information Systems to see the big picture while the project is being executed.
episodes.title: Execution Part 1

episodes.description: In this special episode, Don and the ITProTV team show the project planning phase of the team project--The arcade game cabinet. You see the use of project task assignments, the estimation of duration and costs as the team discusses talk about details of the project and the WBS are assigned for action on this project!
episodes.title: Developing a Plan

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don discuss the execution phase of a project. They start with the direct and manage project work process. They discuss performing the quality assurance methods that were defined during the planning phase. They wrap up the show discussing how to manage a project team.
episodes.title: Executing Part 1

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don introduce the last few executing processes. They describe the tools and techniques used to manage communication during the project execution and what is needed to get contracts working during the project. The finish the show describing keeping the Stakeholders engaged with the project.
episodes.title: Executing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don start next phase of Project Management: the Monitoring and Controlling phase. They talking about the importance of setting good controls in place to facilitate project work. Also, the guys emphasize the controls to help out with change management. They end the show talking about keeping scope creep out of the project.
episodes.title: Monitoring and Controlling

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don give an overview of controlling time management and cost within the project. This episode demonstrates that within a project the close ties between cost, time and scope.
episodes.title: Schedule and Cost Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don show the most common formulas found in the PMBOK and demonstrate how they are used when having to do forecasting for time and cost management within a project. They use the formulas in context of a project, emphasizing the need to memorize these for the PMP exam. The formula sheets Don uses in this episode are available for download bundled in a ZIP file. The download URL can be found in the Overview episode description.
episodes.title: Earned Value Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take us through the final work knowledge areas of controlling quality, communications, risks, procurements and stakeholders. Identifying the importance of keeping current and up to date while the project is executing and while receiving work progress reports so that good decisions can be made to keep the project on time, on scope and on budget.
episodes.title: Monitoring and Controlling Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don guide through some of the most common methodologies used in process management.  These processes include the Six Sigma, Lean and Kanban methods use wildly in project management. Project Managers may be directly involved in implementing these but should be aware.
episodes.title: Process Analysis

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look into the world of Best Practices and Standards.  They help us to differentiate them and talk about some of the standards organization that affect projects.
episodes.title: Process Analysis Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don finish the entire series on the PMP by taking a look the final 2 knowledge areas in the Closing Process Group: Closing the Project or Phase and Closing the Procurements. The last phase is often overlooked but its importance shouldn't be underestimated. It is here we ensure the stakeholder satisfaction, release project teams to other projects and terminate contracts.
episodes.title: Closing

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look into the project management tasks found the January 2016 objectives for the PMP exam.  The describe the tasks, skills and techniques and the processes that Project Managers should know and use in their Projects.
episodes.title: Project Management Tasks

episodes.description: In this example, Ronnie and Don review the Critical Path Method to determine Critical Path. They review the formula used to determine float and the method used to determine starts and finishes of each task.  Taking a single example, they start from just the duration and name of a task and show how to calculate simple forward pass and backward pass.  They determine the float and free float as well.
episodes.title: CPM Example Number 1

episodes.description: In this example, Ronnie and Don take another example that is a little more complex when the forward path has multiple predecessors.  This add complexity to determine the critical path. They show the calculation of the forward pass must be determined based on latest of the Early Finish between multiple predecessors.  They also determine the float for each task
episodes.title: CPM Example Number 2

episodes.description: In this example, Ronnie and Don show another example.  In this example, Don and Ronnie show how determining the critical path helps answer multiple types of questions that a PMP candidate may be expected to answer.  They emphasize the key to success will be math and practice of the techniques shown in this series of examples.
episodes.title: CPM Example Number 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a closer look at how to face the challenge of determining the Earned Value.  They begin with establishing the importance of the PV, Planned Value.  Don shows the basic formulas and then sets it it the context of questions.  The guys demonstrate how to take the given information to determine the EV of a given scenario.  Working through the scenarios, they show us how the Earned Value represent the value at a specific point in time helping us see where were should be at any given time in our project vs where we are.
episodes.title: Earned Value

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don discuss how to determine Schedule Performance.  The Schedule Performance helps us to determine whether we are ahead of schedule based on time, deliverables or even cost.  The determination of the SPI tells us how much we can be ahead or behind schedule and  provide an indicator of where Project Mangers may need to act to bring a project back on schedule, according to the guys.  They show some of the most common types of questions likely encountered by a PMP candidate.
episodes.title: Schedule Performance

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don continue to look at different formulas, this time focus on Cost  Performance.  Using the basic formula, Don shows how to determine what we’ve spent in comparison to what we expected to spend.  This will give us the Cost Variance. Along with the CV, they show how to get the CPI, the cost performance index too.  This is will help when we compare it against another part of the project to help us understand whether we’re over budget or under budget at that particular point in time.
episodes.title: Cost Performance

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don talk about the Cumulative Indexes that allow us to determine whether we are ahead of schedule or behind schedule, under budget or over up to the time you run these formulas.  This will allow you to take a historical look at the project’s cost and schedule performance up to that point.  Don shows how to calculate both and reminds us to watch out for unusual figures that can cause some issues.
episodes.title: Cumulative Performance

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don dive into schedule and budget forecasting formulas.  They begin by addressing the issue of using an ETC, estimate to completion formula.  We learn why we would use it and how you’re likely to see it on the exam.  Don also then shows us that result of this formula is helpful when determining the TCPI, To Completion Cost Performance Index.  Using these formulas will help us to forecast what we expect to need in comparison to the Budget at Completion (BAC).  They also can show us that we can use the TCPI to forecast based on current rate of expenditures.
episodes.title: Forecasting
